The Valkyrie, am I right?

> 
> The Valkyrie, am I right?

I dont think so, the Valkyrie has two tailfins, canards and 6 engines.

Posted [this](http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/forum/showthread.php/17129-0-16-Scale-Recreation-Concorde) in the Spacecraft Exchange a while back.

* * *

![e2zuX.png?1](http://i.imgur.com/e2zuX.png?1)

* * *
nice concord, off to make a plane ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

MiG-15

Will post later today.

It turned out to be a far more manageable design than I could have imagined, and the cruciform tailplanes worked well!

> ![BiP-15a1a.png](http://i142.photobucket.com/albums/r114/Carthaginian/BiP-15a1a.png)

> ![BiP-15a2a.png](http://i142.photobucket.com/albums/r114/Carthaginian/BiP-15a2a.png)

**Edited <time datetime="2012-08-26T20:24:26Z" title="08/26/2012 08:24  PM" data-short="11 yr">August 26, 2012</time> by Carthaginian**

here's my favorite looking real life plane that i have designed.

[http://imgur.com/a/GMmAP](http://imgur.com/a/GMmAP)

I couldn't get the top to be flat while keeping with the design, but it still looks pretty near to the real thing

> 
> here's my favorite looking real life plane that i have designed.
> [http://imgur.com/a/GMmAP](http://imgur.com/a/GMmAP)
> 
> I couldn't get the top to be flat while keeping with the design, but it still looks pretty near to the real thing

Would this be an F-15?
yup! it looks a bit better with the vertical stabilizers being a bit angled, and needs extra engines on those outboard fuel tanks to take off (then i jettison them).

I've been doing this sort of thing as well.
